poem:
Title: Upon the Changing Tides of Youth

Each child, a delicate sonnet unraveling a truth,
In their eyes, reflections - worlds defining anew.
A toolkit of gender, poised in youthful hands, 
Kindling change, still on contentious lands.
Unlawful? A jest in the hall of youth's cue, 
For the heartbeat of change beats in every school room's roof.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
